title.narrative: ZA: CAMPAIGN FOR A FEMINIST GOVERNMENT

description.narrative: Shayisfuba is a campaign which exists to harness and consolidate the voice, organizing capacities and power of womxn#s rights and feminist movements and organizations in order to effectively challenge patriarchal oppression and capitalist exclusion. Thecampaign aspires to organize in service of and together with womxn and gender non-binary people who are both either aligned and organized in social movements and organizations as well as with individual womxn and gender non-binary people who are unorganized and non-aligned working in their respective communities. We believe in our capacity to do this work as it relates to our contexts, as well as in service of building consensus towards a broader feminist consciousness and movement nationally. We intend to build the campaign and organize intensively ahead of the 2021 Local Government Elections. As a core political and campaign imperative, our work will be pursued with the deliberate view of a) building strong relationships with grassroots and community based organizations and b) supporting and promoting African working class womxn in leadership and internal working systems of the campaign. c) Engaging local and national government level decision-makers and other institutions of socialization (eg. religious and traditional institutions; private sector, educational institutions, media, etc.) The ultimate goal is to contribute to making feminist change possible in South African society through influencing policy interventions, at the macro level and socialnorms and behavioral change at the micro level.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam South Africa is an independent Oxfam affiliate who manages and implements the programme of Oxfam in South Africa. Its programme prioritises vulnerable communities and creating lasting change in, and for all the people in South Africa. Oxfam South Africa works in partnership with organisations who seek to create meaningful and sustainable change that benefits vulnerable groups in South Africa through the attainment, protection and preservation of human rights and social justice. The country program will continue to focus its work through ‘active citizenship and accountability’ and ‘gender justice’ lenses.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
